Text.Value: Oh and you'll need this pass - it'll give you access to the Lower City.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Valeria gestures implying giving something to player off-screen

Text.Value: No need to wave documents at me. I'm already drowning in paperwork as it is.
Why must you busybodies insist on interrupting a perfectly good night of...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Hollyphant] trails off as they look at the player intensely
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Valeria trails off as they look at the player intensely

Text.Value: Maybe he gave really boring sermons.
Well, you won't get a sip for free, I insist you work for it.
Now get out of here before you embarrass yourself further.
That's quite the discovery. Doesn't tell me everything, though. Why was Lorgan killed?
Leave.
My assistant. She's posted in the Lower City investigating Duke Stelmane's murder. Now, back to it - what have you found?
Constable Devella is going to be a real pain in the trunk about this.
I'm off the clock. But this is Devella's pet project...
Look, I appreciate the 'amateur investigator' act. It's oddly flattering, with emphasis on the 'odd'. But without hard evidence and an alternate motive, I consider this case closed.
Hang on a tick, I recognise that face. You were talking to Yannis after I left the temple, I'll bet she's put you up to something.
Come back when you've got some real evidence.
And if you want to offload your judgement, I suggest you find someone else to bother.
'Maybe' doesn't quite cut it here, I'm afraid. I need a solid, provable motive.
Why should I tell you? Doesn't sound like you even care.
Well if that's true, that sounds dreadful. And complicated.
I reserve judgement until I undertake further investigation.
You want to know why he was murdered? Bhaal.
Father Lorgan's murder is just one part of a bigger plot, a Bhaal plot.
Leave.
Father Bhaal is letting his children out to play. His acolytes are out running red and rampant.
Who's Devella?
I'm not sure.
Tell her about the murder target list you found.
I found another body in the Flophouse nearby. I think it's related.
That's what you need if you want to change my mind. Hard evidence. A reason, too, if you're at it. Why was Lorgan killed?
Well that's just insulting. I am an Investigator, you know. But I'm off the clock... and this is Devella's pet project...

EditorData.NodeContext: 'But I'm off the clock...' pondering an opportunity to make the player do the work leaving her to get back to her drinking

Text.Value: She asked me to find Lorgan's real killer, seeing as you can't be bothered.
You're telling me more than one person has been killed? In Baldur's Gate? You must have something better than that.
That's the worst thing I've seen all month, and I poke around corpses for a living.
I spoke to Brilgor's spirit. A red-clad dwarf killed them both.
Bhaal's recruiting initiates to his cult. Committing murder is how they receive an invite.
Ugh, fine. I'll bite. What's your theory?
I'm just here to drink.
I don't have anything for you.
Now scram - I'm about to become terrible company.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Valeria and the player take a drink.

Text.Value: I haven't found anything of note.
'Could' doesn't quite cut it here, I'm afraid. I need a solid, provable motive.
Gods. Stelmane is... dead?
I spoke to both corpses. They were killed by a dwarf dressed in red.
While that is startling, it still doesn't disprove my theory that Brilgor killed Father Lorgan, does it?
A tad clich, but I've drunk to worse. To adventure, and all the dull investigation work it leaves in its wake.
As if this cult of the Absolute wasn't enough to worry about...
Since you seem to be on an obnoxiously similar wavelength, why don't you seek her out. She'll be at the Elfsong Tavern. Show her the list, and I'll stay and inform the Fist here.
I assume for the same reason as all the other people on the target list - to gain Bhaal's favour.
To ADVENTURE!
I spoke with Father Lorgan's corpse. He was killed by a dwarf dressed in red, not Brilgor.
Afraid so - I've found new evidence, Investigator.
It's not a theory - I have proof. This document contains information connecting the murders to the Bhaalist resurgence.
Devella's been harping on about Bhaal for months. Fancies herself something of an expert.
I want something compelling. Hard, tangible evidence, and nothing less.
Really? You as well?
Propose a toast, and if it's worth drinking to, that is what we shall do.
That doesn't make sense. Why would this dwarf kill Father Lorgan? I need something more than vague allegations.
Look, if you find something definitive, come back. Until then, leave me to my drink.
What is it with you young people and this need to investigate everything.
I presume you've found something interesting to discuss, if you're interrupting me again?
I need proof. Hard proof. A motive too - otherwise I'm afraid the case remains closed.
Leave.
You remind me of Devella. Fine - if you doubt my conclusions, out with it. What have you found?
A Bhaal plot? You as well?
A group of shapeshifting assassins were under the temple. Along with more murder victims.
I assumed it was just a bunch of conspiracy codswallop and fearmongering, but she's been unusually insistent about this one, even for her.
No. I want proof. If someone else killed Lorgan, I want you to tell me why they did it.
If you want motive, perhaps you should look for it. Preferably not at the bottom of a bottle.
I need hard evidence and a motive. Why would someone else kill Lorgan? How can we be sure it wasn't Brilgor?
Ugh. I know that look.
Isn't it your job to come up with the theories?
I've changed my mind, keep your booze.
I found the murder weapon you missed in a tunnel under the temple.
Well? What are you waiting for? You've a bloody conspiracy to solve - move!
It was the height of arrogance, then, to disturb me. Don't come back unless you've got something worth saying.
I will. And you can keep that snooty attitude, I want none of it.
Could be to do with how he was helping the refugees.
One more for the road and I'll get to it. Wyrm's Crossing... Blasted place...
Another case closed, another bottle open! Huzzah to Valeri-AH!

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Hollyphant] gives a hearty laugh and drinks
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Valeria gives a hearty laugh and then drinks
EditorData.NodeContext: They are emphasizing the "ah" of "valeria" to make it rhyme with huzzah - very very drunk

Text.Value: I'll toast you when we actually solve Father Lorgan's murder. Together.
Until you have something useful to say, leave me to my bottle. It's better company than you are, that's for sure.
To lazy conclusions, and even lazier detectives!
How about the shapeshifting assassins under the temple? That good enough?
Gods. Stelmane is really gone, then.

Synopsis:
Dialog with Valeria in Sharess Caress.
She is very dismissive no matter what you found in Open Hand temple.
